message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with person re-identification in video surveillance, which is a common problem in computer vision. The paper also proposes a metric learning approach, which is a common technique used in computer vision for learning similarity measures between data points. 

The paper also addresses the small sample size problem, which is a common issue in machine learning and falls under the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). 

The use of unlabelled data and semi-supervised learning techniques suggest that this paper may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. 

The use of maximum margin criterion and kernel methods suggest that this paper may also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category, which deals with the processing and analysis of multimedia data. 

Finally, the use of affinity learning and reciprocal nearest neighbor constraints suggest that this paper may also belong to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category, which deals with the security and privacy of data.
